text: Raja Bell (born September 19, 1976 in Saint Croix, U.S. Virgin Islands) is an American former professional basketball player. He played parts of twelve seasons in the National Basketball Association (NBA). He played for the Philadelphia 76ers, Dallas Mavericks, Utah Jazz, Phoenix Suns, Charlotte Bobcats, and Golden State Warriors. He began his NBA career with the San Antonio Spurs on August 2, 2000 but did not play a game with them. On February 13, 2014, Bell announced that he was retiring from playing professional basketball. Since retiring, Bell took a job to work on The Ringer podcast.
